body_html:
This is very nice!

One thing that would be good keeping in mind is that there have been some optimizations that have been performed for non-contiguous tensors that were applied to TH after the ATen kernels were implemented (they mostly concern using OMP to parallelize some operations).
They are present in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/TH/THTensorApply.h , and could be useful as a reference, for example the macros finishing in _OMP

This is very nice!
One thing that would be good keeping in mind is that there have been some optimizations that have been performed for non-contiguous tensors that were applied to TH after the ATen kernels were implemented (they mostly concern using OMP to parallelize some operations).
They are present in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/TH/THTensorApply.h , and could be useful as a reference, for example the macros finishing in _OMP
body:
This is very nice!

One thing that would be good keeping in mind is that there have been some optimizations that have been performed for non-contiguous tensors that were applied to TH after the ATen kernels were implemented (they mostly concern using OMP to parallelize some operations).
They are present in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/TH/THTensorApply.h , and could be useful as a reference, for example the macros finishing in [`_OMP`](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/TH/THTensorApply.h#L366)
